intro: Phaca triquetra, commonly known as the three-lobed bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive three-lobed leaves and small, bladder-like structures used for capturing prey. This plant is typically found in still or slow-moving freshwater environments. It is a carnivorous plant that supplements its nutrient intake by trapping and digesting small aquatic organisms. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
